item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy Surpasses India Great To Achieve Big Feat, India Solid vs Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates: Nitish Reddy Hits Maiden Ton, Father Receives Warm Wishes From Crowd

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy has brought up his maiden Test century for India, playing a crucial role with aggressive batting. Despite losing Jasprit Bumrah, India is positioned comfortably, aiming to overcome Australia’s score.

  • Nitish Reddy scored his maiden Test century.
  • India is aiming to surpass Australia's first innings total.
  • India has avoided follow-on with four wickets remaining.
  • Reddy is the first Indian at No 8 to breach the 90-run mark in Australia.
  • Washington Sundar also contributed significantly with 50 runs.
CENTURY!!! Nitish Kumar Reddy takes a boundary and completes his maiden century.

This pivotal performance showcases Reddy's potential and crucial contribution to India's innings, keeping their hopes alive in the 4th Test.

item.title: 'Stupid, stupid, stupid' - Gavaskar criticises Pant's shot selection - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
'Stupid, stupid, stupid' - Gavaskar criticises Pant's shot selection

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Pant’s shot selection during the match drew sharp criticism from Gavaskar after he lost his wicket trying an unorthodox shot, which was deemed reckless given the game situation.

  • Pant was batting fluently but attempted a risky scoop shot leading to an easy catch.
  • Gavaskar criticized the timing of Pant's shot, citing fielders in strategic positions.
  • Gavaskar expressed disappointment, stating that Pant let the team down with his reckless approach.
  • The former cricketer suggested that if Pant continues to play this way, he might need to bat lower in the order.
“Stupid, stupid, stupid,” was Gavaskar's immediate reaction. “That is letting your team down badly!”

This incident raises questions about Pant's shot selection at critical moments, emphasizing the need for better judgment in Test cricket.

item.title: 'No official complaint from India for Virat Kohli heckling' - says Melbourne Cricket Club CEO - The Times of India
item.description:
No official complaint from India for Virat Kohli heckling, says Melbourne Cricket Club CEO

Publication Date: Not available Source: Times of India

The Melbourne Cricket Club CEO confirmed that the Indian cricket team has not lodged any official complaint regarding heckling directed at Virat Kohli during the fourth Test match.

  • Kohli faced heckling after a controversial moment involving a shoulder bump with Australian debutant Sam Konstas.
  • Despite the crowd's hostility, there has been no formal complaint from the Indian team.
  • CEO Stuart Fox expressed concern only if the heckling escalated to abusive behavior.
  • Kohli was escorted to the dressing room after allegedly responding to fans.
  • India is behind in the Test match, with Australia leading by 148 runs.
“You’re never comfortable when you’ve got fans heavily engaging with the player.” - Stuart Fox

In conclusion, while there were some tensions in the crowd during the match, the lack of an official complaint indicates that the Indian team is taking the situation in stride.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy is on the verge of his maiden Test century, playing aggressively for India. With a crucial partnership alongside Washington Sundar, India aims to surpass Australia’s score and avoid the follow-on.

  • Reddy is currently unbeaten at 85, needing just two runs for a record at No. 8 against Australia.
  • Washington Sundar is nearing a half-century as well.
  • India has avoided follow-on, now looking to surpass Australia’s first innings score.
  • After rain interruptions, the match is set to resume, which has excited fans.
“AND INDIA HAVE DONE IT!!!! The partnership between Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar has helped the visitors escape the follow-on.”

As the match progresses, Reddy's performance could lead to significant achievements for the Indian team.

item.title: World rapid & blitz: Carlsen walks out of tournament after dress code breach - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Carlsen Exits Rapid & Blitz Tournament Over Dress Code Violation

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen walked out of the World Rapid and Blitz Tournament in New York after he refused to comply with dress code regulations. After being fined for wearing jeans, Carlsen opted to leave the tournament instead of changing his attire.

  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, which are prohibited by FIDE regulations.
  • He was not paired for round nine after refusing to change his clothes.
  • Carlsen expressed his frustration, stating it became a matter of principle for him.
  • Another player, Ian Nepomniachtchi, complied with the dress code after being fined.
“Honestly, I’m too old at this point to care too much... Probably I’ll head off to somewhere where the weather is a bit nicer than here.” - Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen's exit has raised eyebrows in the chess community, emphasizing ongoing tensions between players and FIDE regarding regulations and player rights.

item.title: "Could Have Got Him Out 6-7 Times In 2 Overs": Jasprit Bumrah's Blunt Take On Sam Konstas With Whom .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Reflects on Challenging Clash with Sam Konstas During Fourth Test

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent Test match against Australia, Jasprit Bumrah discussed his experience facing debutant Sam Konstas, expressing confidence in his abilities despite Konstas's impressive performance.

  • Bumrah felt he could have dismissed Konstas several times in the early overs.
  • Konstas played aggressively, scoring 60 runs with two sixes off Bumrah.
  • This marked the first time in three years Bumrah was scored against with a six in Test cricket.
  • Bumrah reflected on the unpredictable nature of cricket, emphasizing that performance can vary from day to day.
  • He praised the challenges of playing in Australia, highlighting the testing conditions for bowlers.
  • Bumrah acknowledged the talent of Australian batsman Steve Smith, describing him as a challenging opponent.
Bumrah stated, "Initially I felt I could have got him out 6-7 times in the first two overs but that's how cricket goes. Some days it pays off, some days it doesn't."

Overall, Bumrah's insights shed light on the dynamics of international cricket, particularly in high-pressure situations against young talents like Konstas.

item.title: 'Flower Nahi, Fire Hai': BCCI's Tweet For Nitish Kumar Reddy Goes Viral - News18
item.description:
'Flower Nahi, Fire Hai': BCCI's Viral Tweet Celebrates Nitish Kumar Reddy's Maiden Test Fifty

Last Updated: December 28, 2024, 14:57 IST | Source: News18

Nitish Kumar Reddy, a young cricketer from Andhra Pradesh, made headlines after scoring his maiden Test fifty in the Boxing Day Test against Australia, aided by an iconic celebration and a viral BCCI tweet.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored his maiden Test fifty during the ongoing 4th Test at Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • BCCI's tweet featured the phrase ‘Flower nahi, fire hai’, referencing a popular movie dialogue.
  • Reddy scored 50 runs from 81 balls, helping India avoid follow-on.
  • The tweet and celebration received widespread appreciation from fans and cricket experts alike.
“Haven’t been too many batters across both teams who’ve looked more accomplished than Nitish Kumar Reddy in this series. Surely earned the right to bat No 5.” — Bharat Sundaresan

Nitish’s performance not only brought him praise but also sparked excitement among fans as he rose to prominence in the cricketing world.

item.title: "Stupid, Go Back To...": Sunil Gavaskar Livid With Rishabh Pant. Reason For Rant Is... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Stupid, Go Back To...": Sunil Gavaskar Livid With Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: ABC Sport

Much was expected from Rishabh Pant during the third day of the fourth Test against Australia, but he delivered a careless dismissal, prompting a viral rant from Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Rishabh Pant struggled with his shot selection, particularly a risky lap pull that resulted in his dismissal.
  • The MCG pitch was in favorable condition for batting, and Pant's innings was seen as a missed opportunity.
  • Gavaskar criticized Pant's decision, stating he was letting the team down and that his shot was unsuitable for the situation.
  • Despite Pant's dismissal, India managed to score over 300, bolstered by contributions from Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar.
"Stupid! Stupid! Stupid! You've got two fielder there and you still go for that. That is throwing away your wicket. Not in the situation that India was... He should be going into the other dressing room," remarked Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's comments highlight the need for players to adapt their game according to the match situation, especially in critical moments.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy, Washington Sundar Stitch Historic Partnership As India Go Past 300 - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: No Resumption Time Out As Drizzle Continues In Melbourne

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

The ongoing rain in Melbourne has delayed the resumption of play on Day 3 of the 4th Test match between India and Australia.

  • Ongoing drizzle has led to uncertainty regarding the resumption of the match.
  • No announcements have been made about a potential restart time.
  • Fans eagerly await updates as the weather conditions are being monitored closely.
“The match has been subjected to numerous weather-related delays today.”

As the weather remains unpredictable, spectators and players alike are hoping for a break in the rain to allow the game to continue.

item.title: Watch: Nitish Reddy's 'Pushpa' celebration on reaching maiden Test fifty - The Times of India
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Celebrates Maiden Test Fifty with 'Pushpa' Dance

Publication Date: Recent; Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy has impressed in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series and achieved his first Test fifty during the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Reddy debuted in the Perth Test and had notable scores throughout the series.
  • He scored his maiden Test fifty, helping India surpass the follow-on mark.
  • Celebrated his fifty with the 'Thaggede le' dance from the movie 'Pushpa', entertaining fans and players alike.
“His celebration evoked laughter and admiration from legends in the game.”

This performance marks a significant milestone in Reddy's career, showcasing his potential on the international stage.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Watch: Nitish Reddy's 'Pushpa' celebration on reaching maiden Test fifty | Cricket News - The Times of India
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Celebrates Maiden Test Fifty with 'Pushpa' Dance

Publication Date: Recent; Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy has impressed in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series and achieved his first Test fifty during the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Reddy debuted in the Perth Test and had notable scores throughout the series.
  • He scored his maiden Test fifty, helping India surpass the follow-on mark.
  • Celebrated his fifty with the 'Thaggede le' dance from the movie 'Pushpa', entertaining fans and players alike.
“His celebration evoked laughter and admiration from legends in the game.”

This performance marks a significant milestone in Reddy's career, showcasing his potential on the international stage.

item.title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen announces shock withdrawal; Arjun, Harika, Humpy among leaders after Day 2 - ESPN India
item.description:
FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen announces shock withdrawal; Arjun, Harika, Humpy among leaders after Day 2

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: ESPN

Magnus Carlsen's unexpected withdrawal from the World Rapid & Blitz Championships was triggered by a dress code violation, leading to a $200 fine and not being paired for a round.

  • Carlsen withdrew after refusing to comply with the tournament's dress code regulations.
  • Volodar Murzin, Arjun Erigaisi, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, and Alexander Grischuk are leading the Open championship.
  • Harika Dronavalli, Koneru Humpy, and Ju Wenjun are leading the Women's division.
Ian Nepomniachtchi was also fined for a dress code violation but complied with the regulations.

Carlsen expressed his frustration with FIDE, stating he was tired of their regulations. FIDE defended its dress code, emphasizing professionalism and fairness for all participants.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy Nears 50, 250 Up For India But Follow-On Scare Remains - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar's partnership is pivotal for India as they stand on 250 runs but face the looming threat of follow-on against a determined Australian bowling line-up. The outcome of this match could heavily influence the series and World Test Championship finals.

  • Nitish Reddy approaches his half-century after a confident display of batting.
  • India has scored 250 runs, but six wickets are down.
  • Australia is pressing hard to avoid India building a substantial lead.
  • The match is crucial for India's chances in the World Test Championship.
“The way India plays today might well decide the course of the series and World Test Championship final.”

This match remains critical for both teams as India seeks to avoid defeat while Australia aims to secure an upper hand in the series.

item.title: ‘Nitish Kumar Reddy is confusing team India’: Former chief selector says all-rounder ‘can’t win matches for team with…’ - Mint
item.description:
Concerns Raised Over Nitish Kumar Reddy's Role in Team India by Former Chief Selector

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Former Chief Selector MSK Prasad has voiced his opinion on the selection of all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy, suggesting the need for specialist players in the Indian cricket team.

  • MSK Prasad criticized Nitish Kumar Reddy, stating he is not a complete batter or bowler.
  • Prasad believes specialist players should be prioritized in the lineup.
  • He recommended including Shubman Gill in the Playing XI instead of two spinners.
  • Nitish Kumar has been performing well but struggles to win matches consistently.
  • India trails by more than 200 runs during the ongoing Melbourne Test against Australia.
“Nitish Kumar Reddy is creating confusion in Team India.” – MSK Prasad

In conclusion, Prasad's remarks highlight the ongoing debate about team selection and the potential influence of players like Shubman Gill in bolstering the squad's performance.

item.title: Boxing Day Test LIVE updates: Piastri has playful dig at Kohli’s bump as Australia chase three wickets after lunch - The Age
item.description:
Boxing Day Test LIVE updates: Piastri pokes fun at Kohli as Australia targets wickets after lunch

Published on: December 28, 2024 Source: Live Cricket Update

Australian cricketer Oscar Piastri made a playful remark about Virat Kohli during the ongoing Boxing Day Test. The match continues with Australia aiming to secure three critical wickets following the lunch break.

Key Points:

  • Piastri humorously commented on Kohli's appearance.
  • Australia is strategizing to capture three wickets shortly after lunch.
  • The live updates emphasize the fluctuating conditions of the game.
“At least I didn’t cop a hip and shoulder”: Piastri on his experience during the match.

This light-hearted interaction between players highlights the competitive yet friendly nature of international cricket.

item.title: Ravi Shastri's Rant Against "Desperate" Australia As Virat Kohli Gets Labelled 'Clown' - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravi Shastri's Rant Against "Desperate" Australia As Virat Kohli Gets Labelled 'Clown'

Publication Date: November 16, 2024

Source: NDTV

The recent altercation between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas during the 4th Test match between India and Australia has sparked significant discussion, with Kohli facing a fine from the ICC. Former coach Ravi Shastri has criticized the Australian media for their intense coverage of the incident, labeling it as desperate.

  • Kohli fined 20% of his match fee for his actions during the altercation.
  • Australian media refers to Kohli as a 'joker', stirring controversy.
  • Shastri claims the media's reporting stems from a sense of desperation in a tied series (1-1).
  • He remarks on the Australian media's tendency to target players under pressure.
“It's a little bit of desperation... When you want to win badly... someone had to be the target.” - Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, Shastri believes that the aggressive media coverage reflects the pressures of competition as both teams vie for the Border-Gavaskar trophy.

item.title: Steve Smith beats Virat Kohli, creates history by becoming first player in world to... - India.com
item.description:
Steve Smith Beats Virat Kohli to Create History

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: India.com

Steve Smith has made history by becoming the first player in the world to score 10 centuries in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, surpassing the previous record held by Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Smith's remarkable achievement puts him in a league of his own in the prestigious cricket series.
  • Previously, both Kohli and Tendulkar held the record with 9 centuries each.
  • Smith also scored his 11th century against India, further solidifying his record.
  • His achievement adds to his total of 34 Test centuries, placing him among cricketing greats.
  • Australia posted a massive score of 474 runs in their first innings, with Smith being a standout performer.
  • This milestone sets a new benchmark in the history of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"Smith's achievement places him alongside cricketing legends and sets a new benchmark in the history of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy."

This historic achievement not only highlights Smith's exceptional talent but also enhances his legacy in the sport.

item.title: ‘Stupid, stupid, stupid!’: Great eviscerates India star over wild brainfade as Cummins move pays off - Fox Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Arsenal go second and cut Liverpool's lead to six points - Premier League
item.description:
Arsenal Secures 1-0 Victory Over Ipswich, Climbing to Second in Premier League

Publication Date: December 27, 2024
Source: Premier League

Kai Havertz scored the only goal as Arsenal defeated Ipswich Town 1-0, moving to second place in the Premier League and reducing Liverpool's lead to six points.

  • Arsenal's victory marks their fourth straight home win and keeps them unbeaten at the Emirates Stadium for 11 matches.
  • Havertz's goal came in the 23rd minute from a cross by Leandro Trossard.
  • Ipswich remains in the relegation zone, having lost five of their last six matches.
  • Gabriel Magalhaes missed a chance to double the lead in the second half, heading wide from close range.
Mikel Arteta: "We want to be first, but considering all the circumstances, it's good to be in the position that we are in."

Arsenal continues to show strong defensive performance, maintaining the most clean sheets in the league this season.

item.title: Why Ravichandran Ashwin feels for India’s lower-middle-class - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Ravichandran Ashwin feels for India’s lower-middle-class

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Indian Express

Ravichandran Ashwin, the recently retired Indian cricketer, has voiced his support for the lower-middle class in India, reflecting on his own background and struggles.

  • Ashwin identifies with the lower-middle class as he hails from a modest salaried family.
  • His cricketing journey helped elevate his family's social status, yet he remembers the struggles of his upbringing.
  • He advocates for the often overlooked and harshly taxed segment of society.
“He carries the angst from the days of struggle.”

Ravichandran Ashwin's reflections highlight the perseverance of India's lower-middle class and the importance of supporting this often forgotten demographic.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma is finished': India captain told to 'retire', hand over leadership to Bumrah as fans lose patience - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Faces Calls to Retire as Frustration Grows Among Fans

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma’s disappointing performance as an opener has sparked criticism and calls for him to retire. Following a poor showing in the fourth Test against Australia, fans are urging him to step down and hand over the captaincy to Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Rohit Sharma was dismissed for just 3 runs after facing five balls in the Melbourne Test.
  • His performance has been under scrutiny, with just 152 runs in his last 14 innings.
  • Netizens have expressed frustration on social media, calling for his retirement.
  • Ricky Ponting criticized Rohit's batting performance as lazy and unfocused.
  • Sunil Gavaskar suggested that Rohit might consider retirement if his form does not improve in upcoming matches.
“Out of form is one thing, but Rohit Sharma is giving Negative Energy now.” - Fan comment on social media

The ongoing debate around Rohit’s future in the team highlights the intense pressure on athletes to perform at the highest level.

item.title: "Virat Kohli Sent Him Back...": Steve Smith Provides New Insight Into Yashasvi Jaiswal Run-Out - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Virat Kohli grabs headlines again with his gesture for Steve Smith after Australia batter equals Gavaskar, Lara in MCG - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Congratulates Steve Smith on 34th Test Century at MCG

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: HT Sports

Virat Kohli showed sportsmanship as he congratulated Steve Smith for his 34th Test century during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG, despite facing criticism for a prior incident in the match.

  • Kohli applauded Smith as he scored his century, showcasing camaraderie.
  • The gesture follows Kohli's earlier criticism for a physical confrontation with a young player.
  • Smith equaled greats like Sunil Gavaskar and Brian Lara with his 34th Test century.
  • Kohli and Smith have a long history, starting from their U19 cricket days.
  • Australia scored 474 runs in their first innings, with Smith contributing significantly before being dismissed for 140.
“Kohli's gesture for Smith in the 2019 ODI World Cup, asking the crowd not to boo the Australian batter, earned the ICC Fair Play award that year.”

This incident marks a moment of respect and sportsmanship in cricket, highlighting the relationships between players beyond rivalry.

item.title: Watch: Nathan Lyon Mocks KL Rahul With Rohit Sharma Remark Over Batting Order Fiasco - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Nathan Lyon Mocks KL Rahul Over Batting Order Change in MCG Test

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Nathan Lyon taunted KL Rahul during the second day of the 4th Test against Australia, highlighting a batting order shift that saw Rahul demoted to No. 3.

  • Rohit Sharma returned to open the batting, pushing KL Rahul down the order.
  • Rohit managed just three runs, raising questions about his decision.
  • Nathan Lyon questioned Rahul on why he was demoted while batting.
  • Criticism of Rohit's performance came from notable former Australian cricketers.
Nathan Lyon to KL Rahul: what did you do wrong to bat one down.

The event highlights the pressures faced by players during crucial matches, with public and expert scrutiny following their every move.

item.title: ‘Stupid, stupid, stupid’: Rishabh Pant’s bizarre dismissal at MCG leaves Sunil Gavaskar fuming - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rishabh Pant's Dismissal at MCG Draws Criticism from Sunil Gavaskar

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

In a disappointing turn during the Boxing Day Test match against Australia, Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal sparked outrage, particularly from former captain Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Pant began confidently, playing aggressive yet calculated shots until the 56th over.
  • Gavaskar criticized Pant's choice to attempt a risky 'falling sweep' shot while two fielders were positioned for it.
  • The dismissal was characterized by Gavaskar as “stupid” and regrettable, undermining the team's efforts.
  • Comments from other commentators echoed the sentiment that Pant's decision-making lacked prudence given the match context.
“Stupid, stupid, stupid!” - Sunil Gavaskar on Rishabh Pant's dismissal.

This incident showcases the fine line between aggression and recklessness in cricket, leaving fans and analysts questioning Pant's judgment.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen kicked out of World Rapid and Blitz Championship for wearing jeans; ‘Stupid principle,' says champion - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Magnus Carlsen Disqualified from World Rapid and Blitz Championship Over Jeans Controversy

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Magnus Carlsen, a multiple-time world champion, was disqualified from the World Rapid and Blitz Championship 2024 in New York due to a breach of the tournament's dress code by wearing jeans. Despite being fined and asked to change, Carlsen refused, leading to his disqualification.

  • Carlsen was disqualified for wearing jeans, explicitly prohibited by the tournament's dress code.
  • Initially fined $200, Carlsen declined to change into formal attire immediately.
  • FIDE emphasized that the rules applied equally to all players, including notable players like Carlsen.
  • Other players, such as Ian Nepomniachtchi, complied with dress code regulations after being fined.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE, calling the dress code “stupid” and declaring he no longer wanted to engage with them.
“I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this... maybe it’s a stupid principle, but I don’t think it’s any fun,” said Carlsen.

This incident highlights the tension between individual player preferences and established tournament rules, raising questions about the rigidity of such regulations in professional chess.

item.title: 'Ego kha gya': Rishabh Pant slammed for 'gift-wrapping' his wicket to Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
'Ego kha gya': Rishabh Pant slammed for 'gift-wrapping' his wicket to Australia

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Rishabh Pant faced criticism after a poor decision led to his dismissal during a crucial moment in the fourth Test against Australia. Initially looking strong, Pant's reckless shot selection proved costly for India.

  • Pant attempted a risky lap shot over fine leg after facing discomfort from the ball hitting him on the stomach.
  • On the subsequent delivery, he again played a premeditated shot, resulting in a catch by Nathan Lyon.
  • The dismissal was heavily critiqued, with comments highlighting his reckless approach and reference to ego.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, with both teams showing strong performances thus far.
“What a crap shot by Rishabh Pant. Ego pe baat aa gayi thi and ego kha gya. Terrible way to get out, and Pant is flop in this series so far,”
“Rishabh Pant playing that pre-meditated ramp shot to a ball pitched outside offstump to get out. Looks Indian batsmen have given this up,”

In conclusion, Rishabh Pant's performance in this series has come under scrutiny, and his recent dismissal is seen as a pivotal moment affecting India's chances in the ongoing match.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Rishabh Pant Departs After Flashy Shot, India Stare At Follow On - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates

Date: December 28, 2024   |   Source: NDTV Sports

India is in a precarious position on Day 3 of the 4th Test against Australia after losing their seventh wicket, Ravindra Jadeja. With their follow-on score in jeopardy, the team is desperate to build a solid partnership to avoid defeat.

  • Australia posted a total of 474 runs in their first innings.
  • India is currently 221 runs for 7 wickets with Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar at the crease.
  • Jadeja's departure marks a significant setback as he was expected to score critical runs.
  • If India fails to perform today, their chances of reaching the World Test Championship (WTC) final diminish significantly.
“The way India play today might well decide the course of the series and World Test Championship final equation.”

In conclusion, India's batting performance today is crucial to their WTC hopes, and every run counts as they face mounting pressure from the Australian bowlers.

item.title: Gukesh challenges Carlsen once again, adds drama with brutal response to Norwegian's criticism: ‘When the best player…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gukesh Challenges Carlsen with a Bold Response to Criticism

Date: Dec 28, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

D Gukesh publicly challenged Magnus Carlsen once again after his recent World Chess Championship victory against Ding Liren. Gukesh responded to Carlsen's criticism of his match, stating that it's not the fault of other players if the top player chooses not to compete.

  • Gukesh is the youngest-ever world chess champion, winning against defending champion Ding Liren.
  • He criticized Carlsen for downplaying his victory and the quality of the match.
  • Gukesh emphasized that he welcomed Carlsen's return to competition.
  • He described criticism as a source of motivation throughout his career.
  • Gukesh will face Viswanathan Anand, Carlsen, and Arjun Erigaisi in upcoming matches.
“It was clear that while the match was between two of the best players in the world, it was not a decider on who is the best. When the best player doesn’t want to play, it’s not the fault of other players.” - D Gukesh

Gukesh's bold response and public challenge suggest a competitive spirit as he looks to establish himself further in the chess world.
